TypeSignature.Value: public delegate float IndexedDifferentiableFunction(int index, ref VBuffer<float> input, ref VBuffer<float> gradient);
.class public auto ansi sealed IndexedDifferentiableFunction extends System.MulticastDelegate
Public Delegate Function IndexedDifferentiableFunction(index As Integer, ByRef input As VBuffer(Of Single), ByRef gradient As VBuffer(Of Single)) As Single
type IndexedDifferentiableFunction = delegate of int * * -> single

Docs.param: The point at which to evaluate the function
The gradient vector, which must be filled in (its initial contents are undefined)
Docs.summary:
A delegate for indexed sets of functions with gradients.
REVIEW: I didn't add an here, since it looks like this code is not actually accessed from anywhere. Maybe it should go away?
